premise: When the switch S is closed, the 10 Ω and 20 Ω resistors are in parallel with the voltmeter.
conclusion: They form a single equivalent resistance (R_eq) in series with the battery.

premise: The voltage across the 10 Ω resistor when S is open is 6V.

premise: Using the voltage divider rule, the voltage across the 10 Ω resistor (V1) is given by V1 = V × (10 / (10 + 20)) = 6V.
